intro: Dasyphyllum, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its striking, spiky blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant is typically found in coastal areas, where it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. Dasyphyllum has hairy, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its unique appearance and hardy nature.
